question: [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: request_can_bypass()] [Authorization bypass] Can an attacker craft a malformed Authorization header with multiple Bearer tokens separated by whitespace, causing split_whitespace().nth(1) to select a different token than intended, bypassing authentication checks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: request_can_bypass()] [Header injection] Can an attacker inject special characters (newlines, null bytes, Unicode) in the Authorization header value to manipulate token extraction at line 42, causing the bypasser to match against an unintended token? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: request_can_bypass()] [Token parsing bypass] Does the split_whitespace().nth(1) logic at line 42 properly handle Authorization headers with Bearer tokens containing embedded whitespace, or can attackers exploit this to bypass token validation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: request_can_bypass()] [Case sensitivity bypass] Is the Authorization header parsing case-sensitive, and can an attacker use 'bearer' (lowercase) or 'BEARER' instead of 'Bearer' to bypass the split_whitespace().nth(1) extraction logic? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: request_can_bypass()] [Empty token bypass] Can an attacker send an Authorization header like 'Bearer ' (with trailing space but no token) causing nth(1) to return None and bypass the check, or send 'Bearer  token' (double space) to manipulate token extraction? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: request_can_bypass()] [JWT header bypass] Can an attacker set the X_IS_JWT_HEADER to any value to force early return at line 35, completely bypassing auth token validation even with valid bypass tokens in the Authorization header? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: request_can_bypass()] [Header collision attack] Does the contains_key check at line 34 properly validate the X_IS_JWT_HEADER value, or can an attacker set it to an empty string or arbitrary value to trigger the bypass logic and skip auth token checks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: request_can_bypass()] [Logic confusion] Can an attacker exploit the interaction between X_IS_JWT_HEADER check and Authorization header parsing to create a race condition where JWT validation is bypassed but auth token check also returns false, granting unauthorized access? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: request_can_bypass()] [Header case manipulation] Are HTTP header names case-insensitive in the HeaderMap.contains_key() check at line 34, allowing attackers to use 'X-Is-Jwt', 'X-IS-JWT', or other variations to bypass the intended logic? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: request_can_bypass()] [Dual authentication bypass] If both X_IS_JWT_HEADER and a valid bypass token are present, does the early return at line 35 prevent legitimate bypass users from accessing the faucet, creating a denial of service condition? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: request_can_bypass()] [Token list poisoning] Can an attacker who gains write access to the token file manipulate the ListManager.contains() check at line 48 by inserting wildcard patterns, regex patterns, or special characters that match arbitrary auth tokens? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: new()] [File loading attack] During ListManager::new() at line 21, if the token file contains millions of entries, can an attacker cause memory exhaustion or excessive startup time, leading to denial of service of the faucet service? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: request_can_bypass()] [HashSet collision] Does the ListManager.contains() call at line 48 use a secure hash function for the underlying HashSet, or can attackers craft tokens with hash collisions to bypass authentication checks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: new()] [Token file race condition] Between reading the token file in ListManager::new() and using it in request_can_bypass(), can an attacker modify the file to add their token, exploiting a TOCTOU (Time-of-Check-Time-of-Use) vulnerability? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: new()] [Configuration injection] Can an attacker manipulate the ListManagerConfig.file path to point to a symlink or different file, loading unauthorized tokens into the AuthTokenBypasser? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: request_can_bypass()] [Unicode normalization bypass] Does the manager.contains() check at line 48 perform Unicode normalization before comparing tokens, or can attackers use different Unicode representations of the same string to bypass the check? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: request_can_bypass()] [Timing attack] Is the manager.contains() operation at line 48 constant-time, or can attackers use timing analysis to determine valid bypass tokens character by character? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: request_can_bypass()] [String encoding bypass] Does the to_str().ok() conversion at line 41 properly handle non-UTF8 sequences in the Authorization header, or can attackers inject invalid UTF-8 to bypass validation or cause panics? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: request_can_bypass()] [Whitespace bypass] Can attackers add leading/trailing whitespace, tabs, or other Unicode whitespace characters around the Bearer token that survive the split_whitespace() call but don't match the stored tokens, causing false negatives? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: request_can_bypass()] [String length attack] Can an attacker send an Authorization header with an extremely long Bearer token to cause memory exhaustion during the to_str() conversion at line 41 or the contains() check at line 48? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: request_can_bypass()] [Race condition] Is the ListManager.items HashSet thread-safe, or can concurrent access during request_can_bypass() from multiple async tasks cause data races leading to incorrect bypass decisions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: request_can_bypass()] [Async cancellation] If the request_can_bypass() async function is cancelled mid-execution, can this leave the bypasser in an inconsistent state or leak resources? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Struct: AuthTokenBypasser] [Shared state corruption] Is the AuthTokenBypasser struct Send + Sync safe, and can concurrent modifications to the manager field from multiple threads cause memory unsafety or logic errors? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: request_can_bypass()] [Clone safety] Does the CheckerData.clone() operation properly handle the Arc<HeaderMap> without introducing use-after-free or double-free vulnerabilities in concurrent scenarios? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: request_can_bypass()] [Error swallowing] Does the and_then().ok() chain at lines 40-42 silently swallow errors that should be reported, allowing attackers to probe the system without detection? (Low)
